snippet: In his defense, an educator in Washington Heights showed a picture of the schools chancellor at the time in a similarly affectionate pose with students.
abstract: Case of New York City music teacher Michael Dalton, whose firing based on allegations of inappropriate behavior with students was reversed by an arbitrator, illustrates the complicated task of protecting children while treating teachers fairly; Dalton, whose behavior was deemed not to be sexual, says the arbitration process is a protection against principals using the system to remove teachers they do not like.

byline.contributor: Daniel Krieger and Patrick McGeehan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: In his defense, an educator in Washington Heights showed a picture of the schools chancellor at the time in a similarly affectionate pose with students.

headline.seo: Teacher Argued Double Standard in Successful 2010 Fight to Keep Job
headline.main: In Successful Fight to Keep Job, Music Teacher Cited Double Standard by City
headline.print_headline: In Successful Fight to Keep Job, Music Teacher Cited Double Standard by City
